description: Documentation for the Namespace Overview dashboard - detailed panel descriptions with thresholds and color definitions

links.title: 📖 Workload Details Documentation →
links.tooltip: Open documentation for Workload Details dashboard

options.content:
# 📖 Resource Consumption Analysis - Namespace Overview Documentation

This dashboard provides detailed documentation for each panel in the Namespace Overview dashboard. Use the navigation links to jump to specific panel descriptions or click the back link to return to the main dashboard.

## 🔧 Resource Configuration Status

### Purpose
Shows whether CPU/Memory requests and limits are configured for each workload in the selected namespace. This is a quick health check to identify workloads with missing resource specifications.

### Why It Matters
- **Requests** define guaranteed resource allocation for scheduling
- **Limits** define maximum resource usage before throttling (CPU) or OOM kills (Memory)
- Missing configurations can lead to unpredictable behavior and cluster instability

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset/daemonset |
| CPU Req | CPU Request configuration status |
| CPU Lim | CPU Limit configuration status |
| Mem Req | Memory Request configuration status |
| Mem Lim | Memory Limit configuration status |

### Cell Colors & Values
| Value | Background | Meaning |
|-------|------------|----------|
| **SET** | 🟢 Green | Resource is properly configured |
| **UNSET** | 🔴 Red | Resource is NOT configured - action required |
| **UNSET** (CPU Lim only) | 🟡 Yellow | CPU Limit not set - less critical since CPU is throttled rather than causing OOM kills |

### Recommended Actions
- 🔴 **Red cells**: Immediately add the missing resource specification
- 🟡 **Yellow cells**: Consider adding CPU limits for better resource isolation
- 🟢 **All green**: Good configuration - proceed to analyze actual usage

## 📋 CPU Resource Usage (millicores)

### Purpose
Displays CPU consumption statistics for all workloads in the namespace, including percentile-based usage analysis for capacity planning.

### Units
All values are in **millicores (m)** where 1000m = 1 CPU core.

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset |
| **Pods** | Number of running pods/replicas |
| Min (m) | Minimum CPU usage observed over the time range |
| Max (m) | Maximum CPU usage observed over the time range |
| Avg (m) | Average CPU usage over the time range |
| **P90 (m)** | 🟠 90th percentile - 90% of samples are below this value |
| **P95 (m)** | 🟠 95th percentile - 95% of samples are below this value |
| **P99 (m)** | 🟠 99th percentile - 99% of samples are below this value |
| Req (m) | Current CPU request (total for all replicas) |
| **Req/Pod (m)** | 🟣 CPU request per replica/pod |
| Lim (m) | Current CPU limit (total for all replicas) |
| **Lim/Pod (m)** | 🟣 CPU limit per replica/pod |

### Percentile Columns Explained
Percentiles help understand the distribution of CPU usage over time:
- **P90**: The value below which 90% of observations fall - good baseline for requests
- **P95**: The value below which 95% of observations fall - conservative request value
- **P99**: The value below which 99% of observations fall - good baseline for limits

### Color Coding
- 🟠 **Orange columns**: Percentile values (P90, P95, P99) - use for sizing decisions
- 🟣 **Purple columns**: Per-replica values (Req/Pod, Lim/Pod) - shows individual pod configuration

### How to Use for Capacity Planning
1. **Setting Requests**: Compare **Req** with **P90** or **P95**
   - If Req < P90: Request may be too low, risk of throttling other pods
   - If Req > P95: Request may be over-provisioned
2. **Setting Limits**: Compare **Lim** with **P99** or **Max**
   - If Lim < P99: Risk of frequent throttling
   - If Lim >> Max: Limit may be over-provisioned
3. **Per-Replica Analysis**: Use **Req/Pod** and **Lim/Pod** to understand individual pod settings
   - Useful when scaling replicas to verify per-pod resource allocation

### Workload Links
Click on any **Workload** name to open the detailed workload dashboard in a new tab, showing:
- CPU and Memory usage time series
- Detailed resource metrics for the selected workload

## 📋 Memory Resource Usage (MiB)

### Purpose
Displays memory consumption statistics for all workloads in the namespace, including percentile-based usage analysis for capacity planning.

### Units
All values are in **Mebibytes (MiB)** where 1 MiB = 1,048,576 bytes.

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset |
| **Pods** | Number of running pods/replicas |
| Min (MiB) | Minimum memory usage observed over the time range |
| Max (MiB) | Maximum memory usage observed over the time range |
| Avg (MiB) | Average memory usage over the time range |
| **P90 (MiB)** | 🟠 90th percentile - 90% of samples are below this value |
| **P95 (MiB)** | 🟠 95th percentile - 95% of samples are below this value |
| **P99 (MiB)** | 🟠 99th percentile - 99% of samples are below this value |
| Req (MiB) | Current memory request (total for all replicas) |
| **Req/Pod (MiB)** | 🟣 Memory request per replica/pod |
| Lim (MiB) | Current memory limit (total for all replicas) |
| **Lim/Pod (MiB)** | 🟣 Memory limit per replica/pod |

### Percentile Columns Explained
Percentiles help understand the distribution of memory usage over time:
- **P90**: The value below which 90% of observations fall - good baseline for requests
- **P95**: The value below which 95% of observations fall - conservative request value
- **P99**: The value below which 99% of observations fall - good baseline for limits

### Color Coding
- 🟠 **Orange columns**: Percentile values (P90, P95, P99) - use for sizing decisions
- 🟣 **Purple columns**: Per-replica values (Req/Pod, Lim/Pod) - shows individual pod configuration

### Why Memory Needs Extra Margin
- CPU over-limit: Process is throttled but continues running
- Memory over-limit: Process is **killed** (OOM) - causes restarts and potential data loss

### How to Use for Capacity Planning
1. **Setting Requests**: Compare **Req** with **P90** or **P95**
   - If Req < P90: Request may be too low
   - If Req > P95: Request may be over-provisioned
2. **Setting Limits**: Compare **Lim** with **P99** or **Max**
   - Memory limits should have more headroom than CPU
   - Recommended: Lim ≥ P99 × 1.1 (10% safety margin)
   - If Lim < P99: High OOM risk
3. **Per-Replica Analysis**: Use **Req/Pod** and **Lim/Pod** to understand individual pod settings
   - Useful when scaling replicas to verify per-pod resource allocation

### Workload Links
Click on any **Workload** name to open the detailed workload dashboard in a new tab, showing:
- CPU and Memory usage time series
- Detailed resource metrics for the selected workload

## 📊 Resource Utilization & Risk Analysis

### Purpose
Analyzes resource efficiency (Utilization %) and throttling/OOM risk (Risk %) for each workload in the namespace. This panel helps identify both over-provisioned workloads (waste) and under-provisioned workloads (risk).

### Formulas
- **Utilization %** = `(Average Usage / Request) × 100`
  - Measures how efficiently you use the resources you've requested
- **Risk %** = `(Maximum Usage / Limit) × 100`
  - Measures how close you are to hitting limits (throttling/OOM)

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset |
| CPU Util % | CPU utilization efficiency |
| CPU Risk % | CPU throttling risk |
| Mem Util % | Memory utilization efficiency |
| Mem Risk % | Memory OOM risk |

### Utilization % Thresholds (Efficiency)
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 50% | 🔵 Blue | Over-provisioned | Consider reducing requests |
| 50-90% | 🟢 Green | Optimal utilization | Good balance |
| 90-100% | 🟡 Yellow | High utilization | Monitor closely |
| > 100% | 🔴 Red | Exceeding request | May affect other workloads |

### Risk % Thresholds (Safety)
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 70% | 🟢 Green | Safe headroom | Good safety margin |
| 70-90% | 🟡 Yellow | Elevated risk | Review limits |
| > 90% | 🔴 Red | Critical | Throttling/OOM imminent - urgent action |

### Interpretation Guide
- **Low Util% + Low Risk%**: Over-provisioned but safe → Reduce requests/limits
- **High Util% + Low Risk%**: Efficient and safe → Optimal configuration
- **High Util% + High Risk%**: Efficient but risky → Increase limits
- **Low Util% + High Risk%**: Unusual pattern → Check for spiky workloads

## ⏱️ Time Distribution by Resource Zone

### Purpose
Shows the percentage of time each workload spends in different resource zones over the selected time range. This helps understand workload behavior patterns and identify optimization opportunities.

### Resource Zones Explained
```
                    ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
     > Limit        │  🔴 DANGER ZONE (Throttling/OOM)    │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Limit
     Req → Limit    │  🟢 OPTIMAL ZONE (Using burst)      │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Request  
     < Request      │  🟡 WASTE ZONE (Over-provisioned)   │
                    └─────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset |
| CPU % < Req | % of time CPU is below request |
| CPU % Req-Lim | % of time CPU is between request and limit |
| CPU % > Lim | % of time CPU exceeds limit |
| Mem % < Req | % of time Memory is below request |
| Mem % Req-Lim | % of time Memory is between request and limit |
| Mem % > Lim | % of time Memory exceeds limit |

### % < Request Thresholds (Over-provisioning indicator)
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 50% | 🟢 Green | Good - efficiently using allocated resources | Optimal |
| 50-80% | 🟡 Yellow | Moderate over-provisioning | Consider reducing requests |
| > 80% | 🔴 Red | Severe waste - rarely using requests | Reduce requests significantly |

### % Req-Lim Thresholds (Burst usage - higher is better)
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 20% | 🔴 Red | Rarely using burst capacity - over-provisioned | Reduce requests |
| 20-50% | 🟡 Yellow | Occasionally bursting | Monitor and optimize |
| > 50% | 🟢 Green | Good burst utilization | Consider increasing requests |

### % > Limit Thresholds (Risk indicator)
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| 0% | 🟢 Green | Never exceeding limits - safe | No action needed |
| 1-10% | 🟡 Yellow | Occasional throttling/pressure | Monitor closely |
| > 10% | 🔴 Red | Frequent throttling/OOM risk | Increase limits urgently |

### Ideal Patterns
- **Efficient workloads**: Low % < Req, High % Req-Lim, 0% > Lim
- **Bursty workloads**: Moderate % < Req, Moderate % Req-Lim, 0% > Lim
- **Problematic - Over-provisioned**: High % < Req (red), Low % Req-Lim (red)
- **Problematic - Under-provisioned**: Any significant % > Lim (yellow/red)

## ⚖️ Limit/Request Ratio Analysis

### Purpose
Shows the Limit/Request ratio for CPU and Memory to identify potentially problematic configurations. This ratio indicates the burst capacity available to each workload - how much more resources it can use beyond its guaranteed request.

### Formula
```
Lim/Req Ratio = Total Limit / Total Request
```

### Display Format
- Values displayed with **1 decimal place** (e.g., 2.5)

### Columns
| Column | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Workload | Name of the deployment/statefulset |
| CPU Lim/Req | CPU Limit divided by CPU Request |
| Mem Lim/Req | Memory Limit divided by Memory Request |

### CPU Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive - high throttling risk | Increase limits or reduce requests |
| 1.2 - 10 | 🟢 Green | Optimal - good balance of efficiency and burst | No action needed |
| > 10 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity | Review configuration |

### Memory Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Interpretation | Action |
|-------|-------|----------------|--------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive - high OOM risk | Increase limits or reduce requests |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | 🟢 Green | Optimal - good balance of efficiency and burst | No action needed |
| > 3.5 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity | Review configuration |

### Why Different Thresholds?
- **CPU** can have higher ratios (up to 10) because CPU throttling is recoverable - the process slows down but continues running
- **Memory** needs tighter ratios (max 3.5) because exceeding memory limits causes OOM kills, which are more disruptive

### Why This Matters

**Ratio too low (< 1.2) - 🔴 RED:**
- Very restrictive configuration
- High risk of throttling (CPU) or OOM kills (Memory)
- Workload has almost no burst capacity
- May cause performance issues during traffic spikes
- **Action**: Increase limits or reduce requests

**Ratio optimal - 🟢 GREEN:**
- Good balance between efficiency and burst capacity
- Workload can handle temporary spikes
- Cluster resources are used efficiently
- **Action**: No changes needed

**Ratio too high - 🟡 YELLOW:**
- Workload can burst significantly beyond its guaranteed resources
- May indicate uncertainty about actual requirements
- Could starve other workloads during burst
- **Action**: Consider reducing limits or increasing requests

### Best Practices
- **CPU**: Ratio of 1.5-8x is acceptable (throttling is recoverable)
- **Memory**: Ratio of 1.5-2.5x is safer (OOM kills are more disruptive)
- Review workloads with very high ratios to understand actual needs
- Use together with Time Distribution panel to see actual burst patterns

## 🧪 Resource Utilization & Risk Analysis (Normal Profile)

### Purpose
Simulates resource efficiency (Util%) and risk (Risk%) using hypothetical request/limit values based on the **NORMAL** profile. This helps predict what utilization and risk would look like if you applied the recommended configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request Formula | Limit Formula |
|----------|-----------------|---------------|
| **CPU** | P90 × 1.5 | P99 × 1.5 |
| **Memory** | P95 | MAX × 1.2 |

### Why These Values?
- **CPU Request (P90×1.5)**: Covers 90% of usage with 50% headroom for scheduling safety
- **CPU Limit (P99×1.5)**: Allows burst to 99th percentile with buffer
- **Memory Request (P95)**: Conservative baseline covering 95% of usage
- **Memory Limit (MAX×1.2)**: 20% headroom above observed maximum prevents OOM

### Formulas
- **Simulated Util %** = `(Average Usage / Simulated Request) × 100`
- **Simulated Risk %** = `(Maximum Usage / Simulated Limit) × 100`

### Thresholds

**Utilization %:**
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 50% | 🔵 Blue | Over-provisioned |
| 50-90% | 🟢 Green | Optimal |
| 90-100% | 🟡 Yellow | High utilization |
| > 100% | 🔴 Red | Exceeding request |

**Risk %:**
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 70% | 🟢 Green | Safe |
| 70-90% | 🟡 Yellow | Elevated risk |
| > 90% | 🔴 Red | Critical |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Cost** | Moderate |
| **Safety** | High |
| **Headroom** | Generous |
| **Best for** | Production workloads, critical services |

### How to Use
Compare simulated values with actual values in the Analysis row to understand the impact of applying Normal profile recommendations.

## 🧪 Time Distribution by Resource Zone (Normal Profile)

### Purpose
Shows how time distribution across resource zones would change if the **NORMAL** profile request/limit values were applied.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request | Limit |
|----------|---------|-------|
| **CPU** | P90 × 1.5 | P99 × 1.5 |
| **Memory** | P95 | MAX × 1.2 |

### Zones with Simulated Values
```
                    ┌─────────────────────────────────────────┐
     > Sim Limit    │  🔴 DANGER (would be throttled/OOMed)   │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Simulated Limit
     Req → Lim      │  🟢 BURST (healthy burst capacity)      │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Simulated Request
     < Sim Request  │  🟡 WASTE (under-utilizing)             │
                    └─────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Thresholds
| Column | Range | Color | Meaning |
|--------|-------|-------|---------|
| % < Request | < 50% | 🟢 Green | Good utilization |
| % < Request | 50-80% | 🟡 Yellow | Moderate waste |
| % < Request | > 80% | 🔴 Red | Significant waste |
| % Req-Lim | < 20% | 🔴 Red | Insufficient burst capacity |
| % Req-Lim | 20-50% | 🟡 Yellow | Limited burst |
| % Req-Lim | > 50% | 🟢 Green | Good burst capacity |
| % > Limit | 0% | 🟢 Green | Safe |
| % > Limit | 1-10% | 🟡 Yellow | Occasional throttling |
| % > Limit | > 10% | 🔴 Red | Frequent throttling |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Expected % < Request** | Moderate (generous requests) |
| **Expected % Req-Lim** | Good burst zone |
| **Expected % > Limit** | Very low |

### How to Use
Compare with actual Time Distribution panel to see how the Normal profile would affect your workload's resource zones.

## 🧪 Limit/Request Ratio Analysis (Normal Profile)

### Purpose
Shows the Limit/Request ratio that would result from applying the **NORMAL** profile recommendations.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request | Limit | Expected Ratio |
|----------|---------|-------|----------------|
| **CPU** | P90 × 1.5 | P99 × 1.5 | P99/P90 (typically 1.0-1.5) |
| **Memory** | P95 | MAX × 1.2 | (MAX×1.2)/P95 (typically 1.2-1.8) |

### Formulas
```
CPU Lim/Req Ratio = (P99 × 1.5) / (P90 × 1.5) = P99 / P90
Mem Lim/Req Ratio = (MAX × 1.2) / P95
```

### CPU Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive |
| 1.2 - 10 | 🟢 Green | Optimal balance |
| > 10 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity |

### Memory Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | 🟢 Green | Optimal balance |
| > 3.5 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Expected CPU Ratio** | ~1.0-1.5 (depends on P99/P90 spread) |
| **Expected Mem Ratio** | ~1.2-1.8 (depends on MAX/P95 spread) |
| **Typical Result** | Green zone for most workloads |

### How to Use
Compare with actual Limit/Request Ratio panel to see how the Normal profile would change your ratios.

## 🧪 Simulated CPU Values (Normal Profile)

### Purpose
Shows simulated CPU request/limit values using the **NORMAL** profile, with per-pod values and differences from current configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula |
|--------|---------|
| **CPU Request** | P90 × 1.5 |
| **CPU Limit** | P99 × 1.5 |

### Units
- **CPU**: millicores (m) - 1000m = 1 CPU core

### Columns
| Column | Description | Text Color |
|--------|-------------|------------|
| Workload | Workload name | Default |
| Pods | Number of replicas | Default |
| **CPU Req (m)** | Simulated total CPU request | 🟠 Orange |
| **CPU Req Δ (m)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Req/Pod (m)** | Per-replica CPU request | 🟣 Purple |
| **CPU Req Δ/Pod (m)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Lim (m)** | Simulated total CPU limit | 🟠 Orange |
| **CPU Lim Δ (m)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Lim/Pod (m)** | Per-replica CPU limit | 🟣 Purple |
| **CPU Lim Δ/Pod (m)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |

### Delta (Δ) Interpretation
| Text Color | Meaning |
|------------|---------|
| 🟢 Green | Negative (< 0) - **Resource savings** |
| Default | Zero (= 0) - **No change** |
| 🔴 Red | Positive (> 0) - **More consumption** |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Headroom** | 50% above P90 for requests |
| **Burst capacity** | 50% above P99 for limits |
| **Expected Δ** | Often positive (generous sizing) |

### How to Use
Review Δ columns to understand resource impact of applying Normal profile.

## 🧪 Simulated Memory Values (Normal Profile)

### Purpose
Shows simulated Memory request/limit values using the **NORMAL** profile, with per-pod values and differences from current configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula |
|--------|---------|
| **Memory Request** | P95 |
| **Memory Limit** | MAX × 1.2 |

### Units
- **Memory**: MiB (Mebibytes)

### Columns
| Column | Description | Text Color |
|--------|-------------|------------|
| Workload | Workload name | Default |
| Pods | Number of replicas | Default |
| **Mem Req (MiB)** | Simulated total memory request | 🟠 Orange |
| **Mem Req Δ (MiB)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Req/Pod (MiB)** | Per-replica memory request | 🟣 Purple |
| **Mem Req Δ/Pod (MiB)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Lim (MiB)** | Simulated total memory limit | 🟠 Orange |
| **Mem Lim Δ (MiB)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Lim/Pod (MiB)** | Per-replica memory limit | 🟣 Purple |
| **Mem Lim Δ/Pod (MiB)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |

### Delta (Δ) Interpretation
| Text Color | Meaning |
|------------|---------|
| 🟢 Green | Negative (< 0) - **Resource savings** |
| Default | Zero (= 0) - **No change** |
| 🔴 Red | Positive (> 0) - **More consumption** |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Request baseline** | P95 (conservative) |
| **OOM headroom** | 20% above MAX |
| **Expected Δ** | Moderate (balanced approach) |

### How to Use
Review Δ columns to understand resource impact of applying Normal profile.

## 🧪 Resource Utilization & Risk Analysis (Aggressive Profile)

### Purpose
Simulates resource efficiency (Util%) and risk (Risk%) using hypothetical request/limit values based on the **AGGRESSIVE** profile. This shows a more cost-optimized but higher-risk configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request Formula | Limit Formula |
|----------|-----------------|---------------|
| **CPU** | P95 × 1.1 | MAX × 1.25 |
| **Memory** | MAX | MAX × 1.25 |

### Why These Values?
- **CPU Request (P95×1.1)**: Tighter fit to 95th percentile with minimal headroom
- **CPU Limit (MAX×1.25)**: Only 25% above observed maximum
- **Memory Request (MAX)**: Uses maximum observed as baseline (no waste)
- **Memory Limit (MAX×1.25)**: Tight 25% buffer above maximum

### Formulas
- **Simulated Util %** = `(Average Usage / Simulated Request) × 100`
- **Simulated Risk %** = `(Maximum Usage / Simulated Limit) × 100`

### Thresholds

**Utilization %:**
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 50% | 🔵 Blue | Over-provisioned |
| 50-90% | 🟢 Green | Optimal |
| 90-100% | 🟡 Yellow | High utilization |
| > 100% | 🔴 Red | Exceeding request |

**Risk %:**
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 70% | 🟢 Green | Safe |
| 70-90% | 🟡 Yellow | Elevated risk |
| > 90% | 🔴 Red | Critical |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Cost** | Low |
| **Safety** | Lower |
| **Headroom** | Minimal |
| **Best for** | Cost-sensitive, stable workloads |

### How to Use
Compare simulated values with actual values in the Analysis row to understand the impact of applying Aggressive profile recommendations.

## 🧪 Time Distribution by Resource Zone (Aggressive Profile)

### Purpose
Shows how time distribution across resource zones would change if the **AGGRESSIVE** profile request/limit values were applied.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request | Limit |
|----------|---------|-------|
| **CPU** | P95 × 1.1 | MAX × 1.25 |
| **Memory** | MAX | MAX × 1.25 |

### Zones with Simulated Values
```
                    ┌─────────────────────────────────────────┐
     > Sim Limit    │  🔴 DANGER (would be throttled/OOMed)   │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Simulated Limit
     Req → Lim      │  🟢 BURST (healthy burst capacity)      │
                    ├─────────────────────────────────────────┤ ← Simulated Request
     < Sim Request  │  🟡 WASTE (under-utilizing)             │
                    └─────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Thresholds
| Column | Range | Color | Meaning |
|--------|-------|-------|---------|
| % < Request | < 50% | 🟢 Green | Good utilization |
| % < Request | 50-80% | 🟡 Yellow | Moderate waste |
| % < Request | > 80% | 🔴 Red | Significant waste |
| % Req-Lim | < 20% | 🔴 Red | Insufficient burst capacity |
| % Req-Lim | 20-50% | 🟡 Yellow | Limited burst |
| % Req-Lim | > 50% | 🟢 Green | Good burst capacity |
| % > Limit | 0% | 🟢 Green | Safe |
| % > Limit | 1-10% | 🟡 Yellow | Occasional throttling |
| % > Limit | > 10% | 🔴 Red | Frequent throttling |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Expected % < Request** | Low (tight requests) |
| **Expected % Req-Lim** | Narrow burst zone |
| **Expected % > Limit** | Higher risk |

### How to Use
Compare with actual Time Distribution panel to see how the Aggressive profile would affect your workload's resource zones.

## 🧪 Limit/Request Ratio Analysis (Aggressive Profile)

### Purpose
Shows the Limit/Request ratio that would result from applying the **AGGRESSIVE** profile recommendations.

### Profile Rules
| Resource | Request | Limit | Expected Ratio |
|----------|---------|-------|----------------|
| **CPU** | P95 × 1.1 | MAX × 1.25 | (MAX×1.25)/(P95×1.1) |
| **Memory** | MAX | MAX × 1.25 | 1.25 (fixed) |

### Formulas
```
CPU Lim/Req Ratio = (MAX × 1.25) / (P95 × 1.1) ≈ MAX/P95 × 1.14
Mem Lim/Req Ratio = (MAX × 1.25) / MAX = 1.25
```

### CPU Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive |
| 1.2 - 10 | 🟢 Green | Optimal balance |
| > 10 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity |

### Memory Lim/Req Thresholds
| Range | Color | Meaning |
|-------|-------|---------|
| < 1.2 | 🔴 Red | Too restrictive |
| 1.2 - 3.5 | 🟢 Green | Optimal balance |
| > 3.5 | 🟡 Yellow | Excessive burst capacity |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Expected CPU Ratio** | Variable (depends on MAX/P95 spread) |
| **Expected Mem Ratio** | Always 1.25 (may show red) |
| **Typical Result** | Memory often in red zone by design |

### How to Use
Compare with actual Limit/Request Ratio panel to see how the Aggressive profile would change your ratios.

## 🧪 Simulated CPU Values (Aggressive Profile)

### Purpose
Shows simulated CPU request/limit values using the **AGGRESSIVE** profile, with per-pod values and differences from current configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula |
|--------|---------|
| **CPU Request** | P95 × 1.1 |
| **CPU Limit** | MAX × 1.25 |

### Units
- **CPU**: millicores (m) - 1000m = 1 CPU core

### Columns
| Column | Description | Text Color |
|--------|-------------|------------|
| Workload | Workload name | Default |
| Pods | Number of replicas | Default |
| **CPU Req (m)** | Simulated total CPU request | 🟠 Orange |
| **CPU Req Δ (m)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Req/Pod (m)** | Per-replica CPU request | 🟣 Purple |
| **CPU Req Δ/Pod (m)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Lim (m)** | Simulated total CPU limit | 🟠 Orange |
| **CPU Lim Δ (m)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **CPU Lim/Pod (m)** | Per-replica CPU limit | 🟣 Purple |
| **CPU Lim Δ/Pod (m)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |

### Delta (Δ) Interpretation
| Text Color | Meaning |
|------------|---------|
| 🟢 Green | Negative (< 0) - **Resource savings** |
| Default | Zero (= 0) - **No change** |
| 🔴 Red | Positive (> 0) - **More consumption** |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Headroom** | Only 10% above P95 for requests |
| **Burst capacity** | 25% above MAX for limits |
| **Expected Δ** | Often negative (cost savings) |

### How to Use
Review Δ columns to understand resource impact of applying Aggressive profile.

## 🧪 Simulated Memory Values (Aggressive Profile)

### Purpose
Shows simulated Memory request/limit values using the **AGGRESSIVE** profile, with per-pod values and differences from current configuration.

### Profile Rules
| Metric | Formula |
|--------|---------|
| **Memory Request** | MAX |
| **Memory Limit** | MAX × 1.25 |

### Units
- **Memory**: MiB (Mebibytes)

### Columns
| Column | Description | Text Color |
|--------|-------------|------------|
| Workload | Workload name | Default |
| Pods | Number of replicas | Default |
| **Mem Req (MiB)** | Simulated total memory request | 🟠 Orange |
| **Mem Req Δ (MiB)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Req/Pod (MiB)** | Per-replica memory request | 🟣 Purple |
| **Mem Req Δ/Pod (MiB)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Lim (MiB)** | Simulated total memory limit | 🟠 Orange |
| **Mem Lim Δ (MiB)** | Difference from current | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |
| **Mem Lim/Pod (MiB)** | Per-replica memory limit | 🟣 Purple |
| **Mem Lim Δ/Pod (MiB)** | Per-pod difference | 🟢 Green (< 0) / 🔴 Red (> 0) |

### Delta (Δ) Interpretation
| Text Color | Meaning |
|------------|---------|
| 🟢 Green | Negative (< 0) - **Resource savings** |
| Default | Zero (= 0) - **No change** |
| 🔴 Red | Positive (> 0) - **More consumption** |

### Profile Characteristics
| Aspect | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Request baseline** | MAX (no waste) |
| **OOM headroom** | Only 25% above MAX |
| **Expected Δ** | Often negative (cost savings) |

### How to Use
Review Δ columns to understand resource impact of applying Aggressive profile.
